Articles.Content:
I shared this on Reddit, and thought I may as well share it here as well. It's a helicopter getting all its lift from a rotor powered by rover wheels. It weighs in at 64 tons, and has a top speed around 2m/s.

Craft is available here:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/iab2f1val45149v/E-Copter%20XXVIIII.craft
This has to be one of the most insane things I've seen on this board.... and I've seen plenty.

What's the range on this thing, or have you stacked in enough RTG's that it can run forever?

Impressive build!

That is indeed wow-worthy. Now make the rotors counter-rotating to cut on reaction wheels and increase payload!

Rune. And have a cookie, whenever I get on my computer.
It is... beautiful.
Amazingly amazing.
This is amazing. Now we need to get Scott Manley to fly it.
LOL, it looks like something imagined few hundred years ago.
sweeeeet jesus O_o
Magnificent, simply magnificent. Probably also sporting the most SAS modules this forum has ever seen.
This has to be one of the biggest crafts ive seen, but still so awesome.

This has to be one of the biggest crafts ive seen, but still so awesome.

then you have not seen much. whackjob for example.
This is one of the most awesome things I've seen in KSP. Very well done!

What's the range on this thing, or have you stacked in enough RTG's that it can run forever?

It runs basically forever. If you're fighting a lot with the reaction wheels power dips a bit... but if you're OK spinning a bit, you can regain the power.
I challenge someone to send this to Eve or Laythe

I was thinking if this could be used for eve return missions but carrying that large payload in high gravity would be very hard.

If you could get this to fly at all in eve it could be very usefull
I love this thing. I think I'm going to have to make an attempt at a helicopter now....
No the first helicopter using this system i've seen, but it sure is a mighty one! You must have spent hours on this!
Wow. Most impressive!

Nice. I don't have KSP installed right now but I'm curious: how did you get the rover wheels to all go in the same direction relative to the rotation? I tried to make a rotor powered by rover wheels once but no matter what I tried the wheels on either side of the central axis wanted to go in the same direction relative to the craft (ie, the way you'd normally want on a rover).
Looks really nice.. I'll have to try and build some self-sustainable helicopter like that.
Wonderful, just wonderful.
I tried to make one of these. The wheels didn't seem to have any effect.

*clapclap*

...

Laythe invasion anyone?
Leonardo Davinci called, wants his helicopter back!
